page.title: 17Sheep
page.content:
On a visit to Cople. We went to Chapel End and saw some sheep grazing in a field. Sheep are very useful in two ways. The fleece is cut in the summer for wool.
Most of the local sheep are only kept for a few months after they are born. They are then sold as lamb. The sheep go to the local abattoir or slaughter house on the A603 road near Mill Farm.
On local farms the sheep are fed on grass in the summer and silage in the winter. In the autumn they eat turnip tops drilled into the wheat stubble.
